com.paypal.selion.platform.dataprovider

Class SimpleExcelDataProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paypal.selion.platform.dataprovider.AbstractExcelDataProvider
      • com.paypal.selion.platform.dataprovider.SimpleExcelDataProvider

  • public class SimpleExcelDataProvider
extends AbstractExcelDataProvider
    This class provide several methods to retrieve test data from an Excel workbook. Users can get a single row of data by providing the excel filename, the data sheet name, and they key. Or get the whole data sheet by providing excel file name and the data sheet name. The first column is reserved for keys which are not part of the actual test data. Read Excel Data Provider Documentation for more information on the required format of the Excel sheet.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.paypal.selion.platform.dataprovider.AbstractExcelDataProvider

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleExcelDataProvider

        public SimpleExcelDataProvider(String pathName,
                       String fileName)
                        throws IOException
        The constructor will use the path name and the file name of the Excel workbook to initialize the input stream before the stream is being used by several methods to get the test data from the Excel workbook. If pathName is not null then the users deliberately specified the resource file in other location than the classpaths. If pathName is null, then the resouce file can be found using the classpath.

        Sample usage:

         String   pathName = "src/test/java";
 String   fileName = "DataReaderTest.xls"
 LOCAL_DATA myData = new LOCAL_DATA();
 Object [][] myObj;
 
 // To get a single row of excel sheet using a key associated with the data
 myData = (LOCAL_DATA) SimpleExcelDataProvider dataProvider = new SimpleExcelDataProvider(
                          pathName, fileName).getSingleExcelRow(myData, "4");
 
 // To get a whole sheet of excel data. This will not need key.
 myObj =  new SimpleExcelDataProvider(pathName,
                 fileName).getAllExcelRows(myData);
 myData = (LOCAL_DATA)myObj[1][0];
 System.out.println(myObj.seller.bank[0].name);
        Parameters:
        pathName - the path where the excel file is located.
        fileName - the name of the excel file to be read.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • SimpleExcelDataProvider

        public SimpleExcelDataProvider(String fileName)
                        throws IOException
        Use this constructor when a file that is available in the classpath is to be read by the SimpleExcelDataProvider for supporting Data Driven Tests.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the excel file to be read.
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getAllRowsAsHashTable

        public Hashtable<String,Object> getAllRowsAsHashTable(Object myObj)
        This function will read all rows of a specified excel sheet and store the data to a hash table. Users can get a row of data from the hash table by call a get with a specified key. This excel reader function is for users who want to control the data feed to the test cases manually without the benefit of TestNG DataProvider.

        Note: Unlike getAllExcelRows(Object) this method will skip ALL blank rows that may occur in between data in the spreadsheet.
        Hence the number of rows that are fetched by this method and getAllExcelRows(Object) NEED NOT be the same.

        Example:

         ...
 MyDataStructure myObj = new MyDataStructure();
 HashTable<String, Object> myExcelTableData;
 ...
 myExceltableData = SimpleExcelDataProvider.getAllRowAsHasTable(myObj);
        Specified by:
        getAllRowsAsHashTable in class AbstractExcelDataProvider
        Parameters:
        myObj - the user defined type object which provide details structure to this function.
        Returns:
        an object of type Hashtable that represents the excel sheet data in form of hashTable.

      • getSingleExcelRow

        public Object getSingleExcelRow(Object userObj,
                       String key)
        This method fetches a specific row from an excel sheet which can be identified using a key and returns the data as an Object which can be cast back into the user's actual data type.
        Specified by:
        getSingleExcelRow in class AbstractExcelDataProvider
        Parameters:
        userObj - - An Object into which data is to be packed into
        key - - A string that represents a key to search for in the excel sheet
        Returns:
        - An Object which can be cast into the user's actual data type.

      • getSingleExcelRow

        public Object getSingleExcelRow(Object userObj,
                       int index)
        This method can be used to fetch a particular row from an excel sheet.
        Specified by:
        getSingleExcelRow in class AbstractExcelDataProvider
        Parameters:
        userObj - - The User defined object into which the data is to be packed into.
        index - - The row number from the excel sheet that is to be read. For e.g., if you wanted to read the 2nd row (which is where your data exists) in your excel sheet, the value for index would be 1. This method assumes that your excel sheet would have a header which it would EXCLUDE. When specifying index value always remember to ignore the header, since this method will look for a particular row ignoring the header row.
        Returns:
        - An object that represents the data for a given row in the excel sheet.

      • getExcelRows

        public Object[][] getExcelRows(Object myData,
                      String indexes)
        This function will use the input string representing the indexes to collect and return the correct excel sheet data rows as two dimensional object to be used as TestNG DataProvider.
        Specified by:
        getExcelRows in class AbstractExcelDataProvider
        Parameters:
        myData - the user defined type object which provide details structure to this function.
        indexes - the string represent the keys for the search and return the wanted rows. It is in the format of:
      • "1, 2, 3" for individual indexes.
      • "1-4, 6-8, 9-10" for ranges of indexes.
      • "1, 3, 5-7, 10, 12-14" for mixing individual and range of indexes.
        • Returns:
        Object[][] Two dimensional object to be used with TestNG DataProvider

      • getExcelRows

        public Object[][] getExcelRows(Object myObj,
                      String[] keys)
        This function will use the input string representing the keys to collect and return the correct excel sheet data rows as two dimensional object to be used as TestNG DataProvider.
        Specified by:
        getExcelRows in class AbstractExcelDataProvider
        Parameters:
        myObj - the user defined type object which provides details structure to this function.
        keys - the string represents the list of key for the search and return the wanted row. It is in the format of {"row1", "row3", "row5"}
        Returns:
        Object[][] two dimensional object to be used with TestNG DataProvider

      • getAllExcelRows

        public Object[][] getAllExcelRows(Object myObj)
        This function will read the whole excel sheet and map the data into two-dimensional array of object which is compatible with TestNG DataProvider to provide real test data driven development. This function will ignore all rows in which keys are preceded by "#" as a comment character. For the function to work, the sheet names have to be exactly named as the user defined data type. In the example below, there must be a sheet name "LOCAL_DATA" in the workbook.

        Example how to use TestNG DataProvider:

         '@DataProvider(name = "dataProvider1")'
 public Object[][] createData1() throws Exception {
 
     // Declare your objects
     String pathName = "src/test/java/com/paypal/test/datareader";
     String fileName = "DataReader.xls";
 
     // Declare your data block
     LOCAL_DATA myData = new LOCAL_DATA();
 
     // Pass your data block to "getAllExcelRows"
     Object[][] object = new SimpleExcelDataProvider(pathName, fileName)
         .getAllExcelRows(myData);
 
     // return the two-dimensional array object
     return object;
 }
 
 // Specify our TestNG DataProvider
 '@Test(dataProvider = "dataProvider1")'
 public void verifyLocalData1(LOCAL_DATA data) {
     // Your data will be distribute to your test case
     // one row per instance, and all can be run at the same time.
     System.out.println("Name: " + data.name);
     System.out.println("Password: " + data.password);
     System.out.println("the bank: " + data.bank.bankName);
 
     System.out.println("Ph1: " + data.phone.areaCode);
     System.out.println("Ph2: " + data.cell.areaCode);
     System.out.println("Bank Address: " + data.bank.address.street);
     System.out.println(">>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>");
 }
        Specified by:
        getAllExcelRows in class AbstractExcelDataProvider
        Parameters:
        myObj - the user defined type object which provide details structure to this function.
        Returns:
        Object[][] a two-dimensional object to be used with TestNG DataProvider

      • getExcelRowsByFilter

                                      DataProviderFilter dataFilter)
        Gets data from Excel sheet by applying the given filter.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        An iterator over a collection of Object Array to be used with TestNG DataProvider
